com.pwnetics.helper
Class ItemCounter<K>

java.lang.Object
  com.pwnetics.helper.ItemCounter<K>
Type Parameters:
K - the type of object being counted
public class ItemCounter<K>
extends java.lang.Object

Collection of items and their positive counts.

Queries about objects that have not been added will return a count of zero, indicating they are not contained in this object.

An object's count will change when the object's count is set(Object, int), or when an object is passed to the increment(Object) method such that the new object is equals() to the object already contained in the ItemCounter.

Author:
romanows

sortByValue

public java.util.List<java.util.Map.Entry<K,java.lang.Integer>> sortByValue(boolean isAscending)
Returns a representation of the count map with the keys sorted by their value. This is particularly useful when the key does not implement the Comparable interface.

Parameters:
isAscending - if true, will sort keys in ascending value; if false, will sort keys in descending value
Returns:
an unmodifiable List of (Key, Count) entries, sorted by the Count only.
See Also:
sortByKeyValue(boolean)
